title: Game/Client/Connection Issues
body:
Are the client/disconnecting issues ever going to be addressed? Or are Rioters going to keep commenting on people's post basically saying it is not on their end but the player's end. Ever since the new patch people are having issues, more-so today than other days. On patch day I started having constant disconnecting from client, and chat while also lagging out as if I had packet loss and disconnecting from in game. I was pretty convinced it was my internet, but I guess it was not as my ISP technician said everything was fine and I even replaced my router... uninstalled and reinstalled LoL, I also checked firewall settings.. DNS settings.. Port Forwarding.. Used the Hextech Repair tool..Checked for driver updates.. Followed your "Connection Issue Guide". People are getting bug splats, or getting popups while trying to enter loading screen saying Network Error... which just results in remakes and people getting penalized for something we have no control over.People have lost LP, lost promotion games and have been reported because of this, including myself. Apparently people can't even log into the client at all, or being unable to connect to the client or constantly getting the pop up in client about disconnecting from the client and trying to reconnect stating that "if your connection is otherwise fine please go here and follow these steps" being prompted to exit the client... on top of the other issues I, or other players are experiencing that have been mentioned. This is not just a single region/server issue either. I also know that your servers were having issues with Charter based off of reading posts in the "Help & Support" section of the forums that also stated there, however my ISP is Comcast and people disconnecting from my champ select also use Comcast or other ISP's _**PLEASE LOOK INTO THIS**_ 

> [{quoted}](name=Broporo,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=5ZYcAjcc,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2017-10-02T03:46:57.947+0000)
>
> I've been seeing quite a few players talking about possible server issues today, but it's strange that the servers themselves haven't been messing up. However, I have actually been noticing more and more player's mentioning the ISP they're running, and I was able to figure out that Charter Spectrum has had quite a few outage issues today. Let me know if you're on Charter as well, and if so you may need to contact them to report this as well.

{{sticker:sg-ahri-1}}

replies.body:
We've definitely been looking into the few issues that have popped up in H&S about getting disconnected. I haven't been brushing people off like it feels to you, but sometimes we just need to go through basic troubleshooting steps in order to actually figure out what's going on. I treat each players problem individually, and most of the time the steps in that guide are able to help or at least point me in the right direction to get it fixed. Skipping the basics can lead to a lot of unnecessary problems when one of the first options could have fixed everything.

As long as people are willing to come back and say "Hey Broporo, that shit guide didn't do anything" then I'll most likely give them another thing to try, or at least get them in touch with the experts.

Let's go ahead and run a quick traceroute so that I can get a clear picture of how your connection is looking after it leaves your network. Grab a tool like [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) to run a traceroute to our servers at 104.160.131.1 then post the results here for me.
